article.heading: Etymology
article.paragraph: The city's name is derived from a biblical town, mentioned inJoshua15:21-22.
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: File:PikiWiki Israel 4562 Dimona renewal.JPGthumbleft250pxView across DimonaFile:Dimona Railway Station.JPGthumbleft250pxDimona Railway StationDimona was one of thedevelopment townscreated in the 1950s under the leadership of Israel's first Prime Minister,David Ben-Gurion. Dimona itself was conceived in 1953, and settled in 1955, mostly byHistory of the Jews in Africa#Northern Africanew immigrants from Northern Africa, who also constructed the city's houses. The emblem of Dimona (as a local council), adopted 2 March 1961, appeared on a stamp issued on 24 March 1965.

When theNuclear weapons and IsraelIsraeli nuclear programstarted later that decade, a location not far from the city was chosen for theNegev Nuclear Research Centerdue to its relative isolation in the desert and availability of housing.

In spite of a gradual decrease during the 1980s, the city's population began to grow once again with the beginning of theAliyah from the Commonwealth of Independent States in the 1990sRussian immigration in the 1990s. Currently, Dimona is the third largest city in the Negev, with the population of 33,900. Due to projected rapid population growth in the Negev, the city is expected to triple in size by 2025.cite webUdasinSharonhttp://www.jpost.com/NationalNews/Article.aspx?id‘1.2 million residents in the Negev by 2025’ | JPost | Israel NewsJPost2013-03-26
article.heading: Population
article.paragraph: Dimona is described as "mini-India" by many for its 7,500-strong Indian Jewish community.http://zeenews.india.com/news/nation/rockets-hit-mini-india-town-in-israel_946508.htmlIt is also home to Israel'sBlack Hebrewcommunity, formerly governed by its founder and spiritual leader,Ben Ammi Ben-Israel, now deceased.cite webhttp://africanhebrewisraelitesofjerusalem.com/?page_idAfrican Hebrew Israelites of JerusalemBen AmmiOctober 7, 2012The Black Hebrews number about 3,000 in Dimona, with additional families inArad, IsraelArad,Mitzpe Ramonand theTiberiasarea. Their official status in Israel was an ongoing issue for many years, but in May 1990, the issue was resolved with the issuing of first B/1 visas, and a year later, issuing of temporary residency. Status was extended to August 2003, when theIsraeli Ministry of Interiorgrantedpermanent residency.
article.heading: Economy
article.paragraph: In the early 1980s, textile plants, such as Dimona Textiles Ltd., dominated the industrial landscape. Many plants have since closed. Dimona Silica Industries Ltd. manufactures precipitated silica and calcium carbonate fillers. About a third of the city's population works in industrial workplaces (chemical plants near theDead Sealike theDead Sea Works,high-techcompanies andtextileshops), and another third in the area of services. Due to the introduction of new technologies, many workers have been made redundant in the recent years, creating a total unemployment rate of about 10%. Dimona has taken part ofSolar power in IsraelIsrael's solar transformation. The Rotem Industrial Complex outside of the city has dozens of solar mirrors that focus the sun's rays on a tower that in turn heats a water boiler to create steam, turning a turbine to create electricity. Luz II, Ltd. plans to use the solar array to test new technology for the three new solar plants to be built in California forPacific Gas and Electric Company.Calif. solar power test begins in Israeli desert,Associated Press, June 12, 2008. Retrieved December 23, 2008.Israel site for California solar power test, Ari Rabinovitch,Reuters, June 11, 2008.
article.heading: Geography and climate
article.paragraph: Dimona is at an average height of about 550600 metersAbove mean sea levelabove sea level. It is in theNegev Desert, therefore it has a desert climate with low humidity for most of the year and little precipitation. Summers are hot with an average max temperature of about 33C in August, the hottest month of the year. Average annual precipitation is aboutconvert100mm0on, mostly during the winter.cite bookBrawerMosheUniversity Atlas2009Yavne
article.heading: Transportation
article.paragraph: In the early 1950s, an extension to Dimona and south was constructed from theRailway to Beersheba, designed for freight traffic. A passenger service began in 2005, after pressure from Dimona's municipality.Dimona Railway Stationis located in the southwestern part of the city. The main bus terminal is the Dimona Central Bus Station, with lines toBeersheba,Tel Aviv,Eilat, and nearby towns.
